author: Bharat Khanna
title: Power Demand: Rain brings down power demand in Punjab | Chandigarh News - Times of India
text: Patiala: Power demand in Punjab declined by around 3,000 MW on Thursday due to rainfall in some parts of the state. The demand ranged between 11,400 to 13,400 MW throughout the day. This is in contrast to the maximum power demand of 15,441 MW on Wednesday and 15,658 MW on Tuesday, which was higher than the corresponding period last year when it was 14,770 MW.The month of July witnessed 25% more power consumption compared to last year and on July 17 and 20, the power demand reached 16,023 MW and 16,037 MW respectively. Meanwhile, two thermal power units in Punjab have been facing shutdown, including one unit at GATP Goindwal Sahib allegedly due to technical issues on Thursday. Boiler leakage shut down one unit at the govt-run power plant in Ropar on July 30. One unit of Punjab's independent power producer (IPP) in Mansa tripped for a few hours on Thursday but revived later.
